events.name: MonkeyFest - Global Xamarin Summit - Day 1
events.description: The Largest Cross Platform Xamarin Conference of the year - DAY 1  MonkeyFest is the largest global summit for .Net cross-platform development technologies of the year. This is the place to meet and greet worldwide cross platform community leaders, Xamarin gurus, cloud experts, security champions, devOps bosses, tech evangelists and world class technology speakers. Expect an avalanche of goodness about the latest and best of the cross platform development world, as well as a fair bit of unexpected randomness and a festival atmosphere. The event will take place over 2 days with 3 tracks and 30 Sessions in Singapore on 22/23 September 2017. Day Tickets are now FREE Info and Tickets: https://www.monkeyfest.io/ https://www.eventbrite.sg/e/monkeyfest-2017-global-xamarin-summit-tickets-32577756948
events.location: Microsoft Auditorium (Singapore), One Marina Boulevard, Level 21 Auditorium, Singapore 018989

events.name: How to get a job in tech: Walkabout SG at General Assembly
events.description:
Are you thinking about a job in tech but aren't sure what to do, or how to start? 

Join us at this session to hear about how to get into Web Development, User Experience Design, Digital Marketing, Product Management, and Data Science.
events.location: General Assembly, Level 3, 8 Claymore Hill, Spacemob, Singapore 229572

events.name: Visit Tyk at Walkabout SG!
events.description: On Friday, September 22nd you're invited to check out the spaces, meet the founders and get a behind-the-scenes look at the most innovative companies in Singapore as part of Walkabout SG. Tyk is excited to be getting involved in the action this year!  Swing by our offices at Collision 8 to learn more about our mission to connect every system in the world. Chat to our team, refresh yourself with some drinks & snacks, and grab some swag - we'd love to meet you. Walkabout is open to everyone – you don’t have to be a developer or a designer to enjoy the unique environments behind Singapore’s biggest (and smallest!) tech companies. It’s totally free, but please remember to sign up at the Walkabout SG website, where you can also find more details on other companies taking part.
events.location: Collision 8 High Street Centre, 1 North Bridge Road #08-08, Singapore

A FREE WORKSHOP NOT TO BE MISSED !!!

events.name: Friday Hacks #138: From Scala to SQL
events.description:
Hi everyone! We are back with another session of Friday Hacks! This week we have Dmitry from PayPal who will be talking about Functional Programming and Herbert from NUS Hackers who will be talking about solving complex problems using SQL!

Date/Time: Friday, September 22 at 6:30pm 
Venue: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, NUS 
Free pizza is served before the talks. 


Talk 1: An Introduction to Functional Programming with Scala

Talk Description
This talk will cover basic material about Functional programming with an example of Scala. The baseline of this talk is built on the concept of learning a new programming language through 3 aspects: Primitives, Means of Combination and Means of Abstraction. I am also going to share my personal experience of using Scala in big enterprises and provide some examples and interesting cases. The main purpose of this talk is to acquaint the audience with some fundamental principles of functional programming, to try to rethink core problems of software engineering and to consider advantages and disadvantages of such engineering approaches. We will also talk about areas where functional programming already plays a dominant role for innovation: data streams, parallel data processing, etc.

Speaker Profile
Dmitry Martyanov, Senior Software Engineer in PayPal Singapore, Risk team. Dmitry has over 5 years of professional experience with Scala in different domains like API services, Data processing, and Distributed Systems. Before moving to Singapore, he was an enterprise data services architect in one of the biggest Consumer Digital Banks in the world based in Moscow where Scala was primary language for all middle-tier services.


Talk 2: SQL Queries Wizardry

Talk Description
SQL is the most common language used to interact with databases nowadays. However, due to its declarative nature, many developers do not realise what goes on under the hood. When faced with more complex problems, developers often turn to ORMs (object-relational mapping) which does not require them to interact with SQL directly. Through this talk, I will show some of the more advanced SQL techniques, and how they can be used to solve complex problems we may face.

Speaker Profile
Herbert is a NUS Hackers coreteam member and a Year 3 Computer Science and Mathematics undergraduate. He interned as a data scientist at Twitter Singapore last summer, running SQL queries every day.


Supported by: The HANGAR by NUS Enterprise — the campus hub for entrepreneurs.
events.location: SR3, Town Plaza, University Town, NUS, , Singapore

events.name: TGIFHacks #69 - Telegram Bots: Create Your Own Chatbot
events.description:
In this workshop, we will learn the very basics of creating a Telegram Bot using Python. We will be covering how to create one from scratch, from the basics such as handling chat events and creating custom keyboards to more advanced topics like how to scrape data from other websites and dealing with data storage for your bot. If that’s not enough, we will also be walking you guys through how to make your bot asynchronous and how to get it hosted on Heroku. 

All you need for this workshop is a laptop, a text editor (like Sublime Text, Atom or Notepad++), Python 3 and Telegram Desktop (with a registered account). To get the most out of this workshop, we recommend all attendees to have basic knowledge on Python syntax.

Speaker: Clarence Castillo & Steve Ye
Prerequisites: Basic Python syntax
What to install?: Text Editor (Sublime, Atom), Python 3.6.x
